steps.details: Explore Australian universities and courses that align with your academic goals. Check entry requirements, course fees, and university rankings. Utilize resources like Study in Australia (https://www.studyaustralia.gov.au/) and individual university websites (e.g., https://www.unimelb.edu.au/study/international-students).

steps.action: Apply for admission and receive a Confirmation of Enrolment (CoE)
steps.details: Submit applications to your chosen universities. Upon acceptance, you'll receive a CoE, a crucial document for your visa application.

steps.action: Create an ImmiAccount and gather required documents
steps.details: Create an ImmiAccount (https://online.immi.gov.au/) to begin your online visa application. Gather essential documents, including your CoE, passport, academic transcripts, English language proficiency test results (e.g., IELTS, TOEFL), evidence of financial capacity (bank statements, loan approval letter), Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) proof, and Genuine Temporary Entrant (GTE) statement.

steps.action: Complete the online visa application form and pay the visa application fee
steps.details: Carefully fill out the online visa application form through your ImmiAccount. Provide accurate and consistent information. The current visa application fee is AUD 650 (approximately NPR 57,000 as of October 26, 2023, based on an exchange rate of 87.7 NPR per AUD). This can fluctuate, so check the official website for the latest fee.

steps.action: Undergo health examinations and biometric data collection
steps.details: Schedule an appointment with a panel physician approved by the Australian Department of Home Affairs (https://immi.homeaffairs.gov.au/visas/getting-a-visa/arrange-health-examinations) for required health checks. Provide biometric data (fingerprints and photograph) at an approved collection center.

steps.action: Receive visa decision and prepare for departure
steps.details: Monitor your ImmiAccount for visa updates. Upon approval, receive your electronic visa grant notice. Book flights, accommodation, and prepare for your journey to Australia.

tips: Start early and organize your documents meticulously.
Write a compelling GTE statement demonstrating your genuine intention to study temporarily in Australia.
Ensure all documents are genuine and translated into English if necessary.
emergency_contacts: Australian High Commission in New Delhi: +91 11 4139 4000
recent_changes: Regularly check the Department of Home Affairs website for any recent changes to visa requirements and processing times.

title: Australian Embassy in Nepal: Key Information for Student Visa Applicants
content: The Australian Embassy in Nepal, established in 1984, facilitates diplomatic relations between the two countries. Around 180,000 Nepalis reside in Australia. [1]

citations.quote: Around 180,000 Nepalis have made Australia their home and they are contributing to our countriesâ€™ close relations
